name: ChemVox
0:
”Alexa, open Chem Vox”
”tell me the dipole moment of water in gas”
”what is the absorption maximum of retinal in water”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: chem vox
des:
ChemVox performs real-time quantum chemistry calculations from a voice command and returns the results in seconds. 

Main Features: 
• Calculate the dipole moment of a molecule
• Compute the excitation energy of a molecule
• Determine the solvatochromic shift (|water -gas|) of a molecule
• Choose from thousands of organic compounds 
• Perform calculations in your choice of solvent or in gas phase 
• Receive an email with the results of your calculations (if the permission is granted) 

Instructions:
• Say “Alexa, Open Chem Vox” to enable the skill
• Ask “What properties can you compute?” to learn what ChemVox can do
• Ask “What solvents do you have?” to learn what solvents are available
• Ask “What level of theory are you using?” to learn what level of theory is used for the calculations 
• Prompt Alexa to compute a given property of a molecule in a solvent of your choice
(e.g. "What is the dipole moment of water in gas?" ; "Tell me the absorption maximum of benzene in water"; "compute the solvatochromic shift of retinal")
• To close the session, say “Good bye”

Visit https://mtzweb.stanford.edu/software for more information! 

Feedback:
Your reviews and feedback are important to us! If you’d like to connect please email us at chemvox.mtz@gmail.com.
